definitions.definition: (diminutive) An even number.
definitions.example: So let's see. There are two evens here and three odds.

definitions.definition: To make flat and level.
definitions.example: We need to even this playing field; the west goal is too low.

definitions.definition: To equal.
To be equal.
To place in an equal state, as to obligation, or in a state in which nothing is due on either side; to balance, as accounts; to make quits.
definitions.example: We need to even the score.

definitions.definition: To set right; to complete.
To act up to; to keep pace with.
Flat and level.
definitions.example: Clear out those rocks. The surface must be even.

definitions.definition: Without great variation.
definitions.example: Despite her fear, she spoke in an even voice.

definitions.definition: Equal in proportion, quantity, size, etc.
(of an integer) Divisible by two.
definitions.example: Four, fourteen and forty are even numbers.

definitions.definition: (of a number) Convenient for rounding other numbers to; for example, ending in a zero.
On equal monetary terms; neither owing nor being owed.
On equal terms of a moral sort; quits.
definitions.example: You biffed me back at the barn, and I biffed you here—so now we're even.

definitions.definition: Parallel; on a level; reaching the same limit.
Without an irregularity, flaw, or blemish; pure.
Associate; fellow; of the same condition.
Exactly, just, fully.
definitions.example: I fulfilled my instructions even as I had promised.

definitions.definition: In reality; implying an extreme example in the case mentioned, as compared to the implied reality.
definitions.example: Did you even make it through the front door?

definitions.definition: Emphasizing a comparative.
definitions.example: I was strong before, but now I am even stronger.

definitions.definition: Signalling a correction of one's previous utterance; rather, that is.
definitions.example: My favorite actor is Jack Nicklaus. Jack Nicholson, even.

definitions.definition: Evening.
